parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A liar, deceiver. From pseudomai; a falsifier.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

This; he, she, it.
